definition: uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
abdomen/stomach/belly
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: They make the circus lively and cause people to laugh。
sentences.chinese: 他们使马戏充满生气，使观众捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: In the comic dialogue, two performers revealed the joke suddenly, which made the audience convulse with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 相声演员不时抖包袱，令现场观众捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Consequently, the race has the audience rolling in the aisles.
sentences.chinese: 所以，南瓜赛跑令得观众捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: The naval officer cackled and Faber smiled.
sentences.chinese: 海军军官捧腹大笑，连费伯也微微地笑了。

sentences.english: I want to capture23 for her the belly laugh24 of a baby who is touching the soft fur of a dog for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 我想让她留意宝宝第一次触摸狗的绒毛时的捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Don't make belly laughs when you have a meal.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭的时候不要捧腹大笑哦。

sentences.english: His joke really creased me (with laughter).
sentences.chinese: 他开的玩笑真使我捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: I want to captur for her the belli laugh of a babi who is touch the soft fur of a dog for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 想让她留意宝宝第一次触摸狗的绒毛时的捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: This is a very sidesplitting story.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个让人捧腹大笑的故事。

sentences.english: He acted the dog so well in the play that we all had a good laugh over it.
sentences.chinese: 他在剧中扮演狗子这么好以致我们都捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: They broke into a lot of belly laughs because of Susan's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 因为苏珊的笑话，他们都被弄得捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Was his performance that day really so laugh -out-loud funny ?
sentences.chinese: 他那天的表现真有那么令人捧腹大笑吗？

sentences.english: The comedian was very good indeed. He had the audience rolling in the aisles.
sentences.chinese: 这个喜剧演员真棒，把观众逗得捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: A funny movie often makes us laugh.
sentences.chinese: 滑稽的影片常逗得我们捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Little by little the bus trip turned into one great fit of laughter, an uproarious, interminable fit of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 这段公汽旅程渐渐地变成了一阵没完没了的捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: After initially being angry, he just laughed it off.
sentences.chinese: 在最初的愤怒后，他开始捧腹大笑。

definition: uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to split one's sides laughing
(coll.) to burst out laughing
to burst out laughing/to laugh
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to rock one's body backward and forward/to be convulsed (with laughter etc)
smiling
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
to amuse/to cause to smile/amusing
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to split one's sides laughing
